abstract: Federal prosecutor in Chicago drops most serious charges against 27 defendants who were caught in Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives ‘stash-house sting’ operations that spurred debate over possible entrapment and racial profiling.
lead_paragraph: The federal prosecutor’s decision seemed to be a partial retreat from so-called stash-house drug stings that spurred a debate over possible entrapment and racial profiling.
snippet: The federal prosecutor’s decision seemed to be a partial retreat from so-called stash-house drug stings that spurred a debate over possible entrapment and racial profiling.

keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Prosecutor Drops Toughest Charges in Chicago Stings That Used Fake Drugs
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Drops Toughest Charges in Chicago Stings That Used Fake Drugs
